intro: Mesostemma kotschyanum, commonly known as the Kotschyan's mesostemma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. Mesostemma kotschyanum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
